titleStmt.title: The Princes ORIANA of Great Brittaine, to Lady Dulcinea de Toboso.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: The Princes ORIANA of Great Brittaine, to Lady Dulcinea de Toboso.

monogr.title: The history of the valorovs and vvittie knight-errant, Don-Qvixote of the Mancha. Translated out of the Spanish
monogr.author: Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de

div.head: The Princes ORIANA of Great Brittaine, to Lady Dulcinea de Toboso.

lg.l: HAppie those which, for more commoditie
And ease Dulcinea faire! could bring to passe,
That Greene Witch, where Toboso is might bee,
And London chang'd, where thy Knights village was.
Happie she that might body and soule adorne
With thy rich li'uery, and thy hie desire:
And see thy happie Knight by honour borne
In cruell combat, broaching out his Ire.
But happiest she, that might so cleanly scape
From Amadis, as thou hast whilome done
From thy well manered Knight, Curteous Quixote:
O! were I shee, Id'e enuy now ones hap,
And had beene merry, when I most did moane
And tane my pleasure, without paying shot.
